metadata.title: Viral Diarrhoea in a Rural Coastal Region of Karnataka India

abstract.original_text: A total of 106 children below 5 years of age admitted to the Kasturba Medical College Hospital Manipal Karnataka (South India) were investigated over a period of 6 months to determine the aetiological role of viruses in acute diarrhoea. Viral aetiological agents isolated were Rotaviruses in 12 (11 per cent) cases, Adenoviruses in 3 (3 per cent) cases, corona virus and astroviruses in two (2 per cent) cases each. Non-viral isolates were Cryptosporidium and Salmonella typhimurium in two cases each, and Entamoeba histolytica and Shigella flexneri in one case each.

sentences.segment_text: A total of 106 children below 5 years of age admitted to the Kasturba Medical College Hospital Manipal Karnataka ( South India ) were investigated over a period of 6 months to determine the aetiological role of viruses in acute diarrhoea .
Viral aetiological agents isolated were Rotaviruses in 12 ( 11 per cent ) cases ,
corona virus and astroviruses in two ( 2 per cent ) cases each .
Non-viral isolates were Cryptosporidium and Salmonella typhimurium in two cases each ,
and Entamoeba histolytica and Shigella flexneri in one case each .
